div.a: Assessment of automatic, real-time pre-analytical quality checks and tools for continuous improvement (Derriford)
2017 AACC GEM Premier 5000 Clinical Evaluation at CHR Citadelle (Belgium)
2018 AACC GEM Premier 5000 Perfomance at CHR Citadelle (Belgium)
Meeting ISO 15189:2012 and 22870:2016 Requirements for Quality and Competence
iCa Clinical and Economic Reprint Holder
Ionized Calcium Accuracy at Low Levels
Benefits of CO-Ox Monitoring in RBC Transfusions: CABG and VR

translation.system.overview:
System Overview
Offers real-time assurance, advanced
simplicity, and complete control
in the lab and at the point of care.
translation.gem5k.title:
GEM Premier 5000 with iQM2
A complete solution for improved patient care and efficiency.
translation.gempak.title:
All-in-One, Multi-Use GEM PAK
Advanced simplicity at the point of care.
translation.gemweb5.title:
GEMweb Plus 500
Management and compliance simplified.
translation.gem5k.text:
GEM Premier 5000 with iQM2
Portable blood gas system to rapidly analyze heparinized whole blood samples at the point-of-care and in the laboratory.
Quantitative measurement of the following analytes: pH, pCO2, pO2, Na+, K+, Ca++, CI-, Hct, Glu, Lac, tBili, tHb, O2Hb, COHb, MetHb, HHb and sO2
New features deliver advanced cybersecurity, enhanced Wi-Fi and remote support.

ul.li: Provides high-powered processing of results and reports.
Designed for intuitive operation by any operator.

translation.gem5k.button2: GEM PAK contains all components required for analysis and eliminates analyzer maintenance.

gem5k.popup1.div:
Testimonial
“It puts everything in front that you’re looking for so you don’t have to search...very easy to aspirate...very self-explanatory...[overall] very easy to use, and there’s less contact with the blood, so less chance of getting it on yourself.”
Respiratory Therapist
GEM Premier 5000 System Human Factors
Testing Participant - (i-STAT user) GEM Premier 5000 System Human Factors Testing. Data on file, IL.

tr.th: Specifications – Analytes, Parameters, Time to Result and Sample Type

tr.td: pH, pCO2, pO2, Na+, K+, Ca++, Cl-, Glu, Lac, Hct, tHb, O2Hb, COHb, MetHb, HHb, tBili* sO2**
BE(B), BE(ecf), tHb(c), Ca++(7.4), Anion gap (AG), P/F ratio, pAO2, CaO2, CvO2, p50, O2cap, sO2(c), O2ct, HCO3-std, TCO2, HCO3-(c), A-aDO2, paO2/pAO2, RI, CcO2, a-vDO2, Qsp/Qt (est), Qsp/Qt, Hct(c)
45 seconds from simple introduction, including IntraSpect quality check

*PAKs available with or without tBili.
**sO2 = Ratio between the concentration of oxyhemoglobin and oxyhemoglobin plus deoxyhemoglobin.

tr.th: Specifications – GEM PAK, Interface Protocols and Dimensions

tr.td: ASTM or HL7 enables data transmission to laboratory, hospital or third-party information-management system
Instrument - H: 18.6 in, W: 13 in, D: 16.4 in, Wt: 45.4 lbs
GEM PAK - H: 6.75 in, W: 10 in, D: 8 in, Wt: 8.1 lbs
*All PAKs, except 600-test PAK which has a 21-day use-life

translation.new.text:
Advanced Simplicity with
Real-Time Assurance
Custom Quick Start sampling
Smartcolor status bar
i-button for iQM2
Illuminated sampling area
Universal sampling
Rapid time to results: 45 seconds
iQM2 with IntraSpect™ technology
AutoPAK Validation

new.04.font:
Provides a complete picture of
quality for each sample

new.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“iQM2 provides faster cartridge initialization, enhanced sample interference detection and scores high for ease-of-use by POC operators.”
James A Nichols, PhD
Medical Director, Clinical Chemistry, and Associate Medical Director for Clinical Operations
Vanderbilt University School of Medicine, Nashville, TN, USA
GEM Premier 5000 Clinical Evaluation. Poster presented at: 26th International AACC Point-of-Care Conference: Sept. 2016; Copenhagen, Denmark.

ul.li: Provides one-touch menu selection with flexible configurations, customizable by department
Reduces pre-analytical interaction time with the analyzer, enabling more time for patient care
Improves overall sample-processing efficiency by reducing time to result
Ensures proper sample introduction, for accurate aspiration with every sample

Improves patient care by reducing sample re-draws
Guides operator during aspiration of short samples, avoiding patient sample waste
Enhances visibility in dimly lit environments
Ensures proper insertion of sample device
Ergonomic sampler provides ambidextrous sample introduction, improving ease-of-use for a variety of operators
Tactical feedback guides sampling device to accurate aspiration position
Visual and audible feedback inform user when sample aspiration is complete
Offers analyzer status at a glance

Clear color-coding:
Green = ready
Blue = ready (interruptible process)
Yellow = user action
Red = locked state
Provides real-time messaging for all analysis and quality processes

Provides real-time information on iQM2 and sample workflow processes, including:
Rinsing, Sensor Checks, iQM2 Checks, IntraSpect Checks, Pattern Recognition Checks
Count-down timer informs user when analyzer will be ready to run the next sample, allowing the user to plan analysis activities
Conveys status of analyzer and analytes quickly
Offers status descriptions for every analyte with the touch of a button, from the Quick Start GUI
Provides analyzer/analyte status to inform decision making
Hands-free in presentation mode
Enables one-handed scanning for patient identification
Flexible installation (on left or right side of analyzer) to support various user and space requirements
Allows for hand-held remote scanning for hard-to-reach barcodes
Provides a complete picture of quality for each sample, for real-time quality assurance

Detects abnormal sensor response or residual error during the measurement process that may be caused by:
Micro-clots, micro-bubbles, interferences, or dyes/lipids in CO-Ox
Identifies sensor-slope shape and coefficient deviation
Automatically standardizes time-to-ready state after PAK insertion
Ensures system is ready to provide quality-assured, optimal results in less than one hour after GEM PAK insertion
No additional hands-on time required—just replace the PAK once every 31 days*

translation.new.popup11:
Enhanced Speed and Throughput with Quality Checks
45-second time-to-result, 29 samples/hour for improved efficiency
Performs IntraSpect checks during sample measurement process, to ensure rapid quality results
Ensures quality and speed for improved patient care

translation.new.popup04.title: Universal Sampling

and analyzed in 15 seconds.

Sample volume
and sample
integrity check
translation.quickstart.text:
Custom Quick Start Sampling
Programs shortcuts to expedite testing:
Reduces actions required to initiate testing
Reduces potential for errors during sample analysis
Enables staff to spend less time with the analyzer and more time at the patient bedside

quickstart.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“After a brief introduction, all users were able to operate the GEM Premier 5000 without errors. This is due to the intuitive user interface [...]. The configurable Quick Start menu allows analysis to be started with just one button.”
Hugo Stiegler, MD
Head of Department Laboratory Medicine
Bergmannsheil, Bochum Germany
Das Intelligente Blutgas-Analysesystem. Medzin Wissenschaft. 2016;May;16-7

translation.smartcolor.text:
Smartcolor Status Bar
Analyzer status at a glance:
Delivers real-time iQM2 updates
Provides instant analyzer and
analyte status
translation.quality.text:
Quality Assurance Reports
Regulatory compliance is effortless. Report generated automatically and available on-demand, including:
iQM2 Delta Chart
iQM2 Corrective Action
CVP
Patient History
Advanced Reports*
Audit Logs
Sample Handling
eSignature Workflow
Sample Turnaround Time
*Available on demand from analyzer, PC or tablet
with GEMweb Plus 500 Custom Connectivity
translation.quality.button: Review enhanced reports on system, or remotely via GEMweb Plus 500 Custom Connectivity

quality.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“New features of the GEM Premier 5000 system contribute to improved risk-control, especially in POC conditions.”
Benedicte Neneteau-burnat, et al.
Biochemical Laboratory
Saint Antoine Hospital Paris, France
GEM Premier 5000 (Werfen): Analyzer evaluation, risk assessment and practicability. Poster presented at: 26th International AACC Point-of-Care Conference; Sept. 2016; Copenhagen, Denmark.

translation.quality.popup02: iQM2 Delta Chart Reports are automatically generated for each PCS, assuring documentation compliance. Available in print-format or viewable on analyzer screen.
translation.quality.popup03: iQM2 Corrective Action Reports automate manual troubleshooting and documentation, simplifying regulatory compliance. Available in print-format or viewable on analyzer screen.
translation.quality.popup04: iQM2 CVP Reports document AutoPAK Validation (APV) prior to clinical use. Available in print-format or viewable on analyzer screen.
translation.quality.popup05: Trending reports for monitoring critical levels, history and delta measurements available on the analyzer, or remotely with GEMweb Plus 500 Custom Connectivity. Critical Values can be configured by the user for ultimate simplicity.
translation.quality.popup06:
Available with GEMweb Plus 500 Custom Connectivity and accessible from analyzer, Audit Logs provide full visibility and traceability of:
Patient record amendment and access
System configuration and access
Operator security configuration
translation.quality.popup07: Configurable electronic signature workflows ensure a timely and complete quality assurance program, inspection-ready at the touch of a button. Available with GEMweb Plus 500 Custom Connectivity and accessible from analyzer.
translation.quality.popup08:
Available with GEMweb Plus 500 Custom Connectivity and accessible from analyzer, Enhanced Reports facilitate targeted operator training, for improved efficiency.
Sample Turnaround Reports provide detailed examination of operator turnaround time.
translation.quality.popup09:
Available with GEMweb Plus 500 Custom Connectivity and accessible from analyzer, Enhanced Reports facilitate targeted operator training, for improved efficiency.
Sample Handling Reports link Corrective Action Report data to corresponding operators.
translation.allinone.text:
All-in-One, Multi-Use GEM PAK
Contains all analytical testing components in a single, maintenance-free, closed system. Enables patented iQM2 Pattern Recognition software to predict errors, ensuring accuracy of results. No user intervention required.
translation.allinone.button01: Analyzes 5 levels of Process Control Solutions (PCSs) continuously to confirm sensor and PAK performance.
translation.allinone.button02: The only testing system with an all-in-one, multi-use cartridge.

allinone.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“[Our] analysis confirmed [...] the continuity and operational reliability offered by [GEM Premier systems with iQM]. [...] The advantage of [iQM] analytical data and [GEM PAK] “all-in-one” philosophy has been demonstrated.”
Marco Rambaldi, MD
Director, Post Operative Intensive Care
AUSL Ospedae Nuevo Sant'Agostino
Modena, Italy
Blood gas and patient safety: considerations based on experience developed in accordance with Risk Management perspective. Clin Chem Lab Med, 2007;46(6):774-80. [study revealed significant labor savings, enhanced productivity and reduced risk compared to traditional systems].

ul.li: Each PCS serves a specific function within iQM2 processes
Established target values across all PCSs monitor MDLs and ensure accuracy of results
Measures sensitivity/drift and accuracy at Medical Decision Levels (MDLs)
Utilized for pattern recognition check and verification
Measures drift and accuracy at MDLs
Utilized for pattern recognition check and verification
Utilized as corrective action for clots and high frequency after interference
Remains over sensors with outputs checked every 30 seconds
Measures drift at low level pO2, pH and pCO2
Conditions interference rejection membrane for glucose/lactate
Used for AutoPAK Validation (APV) prior to sample analysis
Measures drift and accuracy at MDLs
Used for APV prior to sample analysis
Measures drift and accuracy at MDLs

translation.allinone.popup03.title: Sensor Card Test Equipment

ul.li: 100% use-life guarantee for every GEM PAK

Every sensor card is 100% tested utilizing NIST-traceable solution prior to GEM PAK build
Ensures quality of each analyte prior to clinical use

translation.allinone.popup04.title: Rigorous Simulation Testing Ensures PAK Performance
translation.allinone.popup04: All PCS lot combinations are tested with aqueous and whole blood samples in the Customer Simulation Lab, prior to customer shipment.
translation.allinone.popup05.title: Quality Checks at Every Stage
translation.allinone.popup05: Prior to GEM PAK shipment, quality checks are performed during each manufacturing stage, ensuring GEM PAK performance and integrity.
translation.self.text:
Self-Contained, Closed System
Automates the most labor- and skill- intensive processes:
Zero maintenance: one room- temperature PAK to inventory and manage
Replaced every 31 days*: no hands- on troubleshooting or corrective actions required
Ensures patient and operator safety: biohazard exposure minimized
* 21-day onboard use-life for 600-test PAK.
translation.self.button: GEM PAK contains all analytical and quality control components.

self.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“iQM greatly simplifies the testing process and allows caregivers to use the test data in an environment of assured quality to focus, appropriately, on the patient.”
Sharon Ehrmeyer, PhD
Professor, Pathology and Laboratory Medicine
University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health
From Quality Control and Quality Assurance to Assured Quality. Point Care. 2013;2:188-94.

ul.li: PCSs are traceable to National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) or Clinical and Laboratory Standards Institute (CLSI) primary standards
PCSs are performed continuously and after every sample, exceeding the frequency of normal traditional quality control

tr.td:
Every 30 minutes or after every sample, whichever comes first.
Every 30 seconds when no samples run

translation.self.popup03.title: Annual Cartridge Utilization Comparison
translation.self.popup03.img10:
Based on 1 analyzer with annual sample volume ≈ 4,800 and QC requirement of 3 times/day. Data on file, IL.
Requires refrigeration.

ul.li: Includes all testing components: sensors, CO-Ox optical cell, lysing solution, PCSs, tubing, waste bag and sampler
Only 1 PAK to inventory and manage, including all solutions, sensors and quality control

translation.self.popup04.title: Positive Impact on Staff Time
translation.self.popup04.img02:
Annual Sample Volume
Minnimum Daily QC Requirement
Number of Analyzers
translation.self.popup04: Automates the most labor-intensive tasks associated with analyzer maintenance/troubleshooting and quality management.
translation.self.popup05.title: Ensures Patient and Operator Safety

ul.li: All components are self-contained, limiting biohazard exposure for operator
No blood flows through the analyzer, confining blood waste to the disposable GEM PAK

translation.autopak.text:
AutoPAK Validation
Two independent NIST-traceable solutions automatically validate PCS integrity and overall system performance prior to sample analysis.
Reduces consumable requirements (ampoules)
Consistently validates GEM PAK prior to sample aspiration with <1 hr time-to-ready
Reduces staff time
translation.autopak.button: After succesful installation and validation through APV, GEM PAK is available for patient sample analysis and iQM2 assumes control of the analytical system.
translation.autopak.popup02.title: Time to Ready in <1 Hour, with AutoPAK Validation (APV)

ul.li: 97.2% GEM PAKs ready <60 minutes
99.2% GEM PAKs ready <70 minutes
Automatically standardizes time-to-ready state after PAK insertion
Ensures system is ready to provide quality-assured, optimal results in >1 hour after GEM PAK insertion
No additional hands-on time required──just replace the PAK once every 31 days*

translation.sensor.text:
Sensor Card
Integral to the GEM PAK, the miniaturized sensor-card design optimizes analytical performance.
Up to 10 analytes
Up to 600 samples (>9,000 analyte results) with no impact on performance
30+ years of sensor-technology expertise
translation.sensor.button: IQM2 immediately detects, corrects and documents errors specific to an individual analyte─ensuring every patient test result meets rigorous quality specifications.
translation.sensor.popup: GEM Premier 5000 sensor card and CO-Oximetry module measurement methodologies

tr.td: pH, pCO2, Na+, K+ Ca++, Cl-

translation.nist.text:
NIST-Traceable Process Control Solutions (PCSs)
5 PCSs continuously confirm sensor and PAK performance:
Traceable to primary standards*
Each PCS follows the same pathway as a sample and serves a specific function in the iQM2 process
Established target values monitor Medical Decision Levels (MDLs)—essential for accurate clinical decisions
*Clinical & Laboratory Standards Institute (CLSI) and National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
translation.nist.button02: Each PCS is contained in an impermeable, air-tight bag, resistant to changes in barometric pressure or air contamination.
translation.nist.button03: NIST-traceable PCSs ensure analytical performance of sensors and reagents, for a quality-assured sample, every time.
translation.nist.button01: Potential for hundreds of PCS replicates to run daily, ensuring accuracy of each patient result (total number of replicates is dependent upon sample volume).
translation.nist.popup01.title: Medical Decision Levels (MDLs): What and Why

ul.li: A decision level is a threshold value above and below which a particular patient management action is recommended
There may be several MDLs for any given analyte

Protocols and treatment algorithms that incorporate MDLs include:
Sepsis guidelines for Lactate and Glucose
ARDSnet and ALVEOLI guidelines for pO2 (P/F ratio)
MetHb levels for Nitric Oxide therapy decisions (e.g., Persistent Pulmonary Hypertension treatment in newborns)

translation.nist.popup02.title: Reference Range, Critical Value and Medical Decision Level
translation.nist.popup02.text:
Reference Range: Usually defined as the set of values covering 95% of the normal population
Critical Value: Lab value that must be immediately reported to a care provider
MDL: Concentration of an analyte, at which some medical action is indicated for proper patient care
Examples below
Analyte Reference Range MDL Critical Value
pH 7.35-7.45 7.30,7.45 7.20,7.60
pH 83-108 60 40
K* 3.5-5.1 3.0,5.8 2.8-7.8
Lac 0.36-0-75 (at rest) 2.0 ≥3.4
translation.nist.popup03.title: iQM2 Continuous Quality Checks Allow MDL Monitoring

ul.li: Process Control Solutions (PCSs) monitor analyte performance and precision at MDLs
5 levels of PCSs (A, B, C, D and E allow for greater coverage of MDL requirements)

MDL monitoring with traditional Quality Control is limited
Quality controls are created at low, medium and high levels to monitor analyte precision acceptability
Each level is performed only once/day

nist.popup04.p:
Source:
Burtis C, Bruns D. Tietz Fundamentals of Clinical Chemistry and Molecular Diagnostic, 7th edition. St. Louis, MO: Elsevier Saunders. 2015:952-82.
Statland BE. Clinical Decision Levels for Lab Test, 2nd edition. Oradell, NJ: Medical Economics Company Inc. 1987.
Kost GJ. Table of Critical Limits, Clinical Laboratory Reference. 2013-2014(6-7).

nist.popup05.p:
Source:
*R – References indicate Lactate should be trended for clearance
Levraut J, Ichai C, Petit I, et al. "Low Exogenous Lactate Clearance As An Early Predictor of Mortality in Normolactatemic Critically Ill Septic Patients", Critical Care Medicine. 2003; 31(3):705-10.
Note: All data based upon analyzer Operators Manuals

b.font: MDL Monitoring by Critical Care Analyzer

translation.coox.text:
CO-Oximetry
Integrated CO-Oximetry for safe and efficient patient management:
tHb - useful in blood transfusion management1
MetHb - useful in Nitric Oxide treatment monitoring2
tBili - useful in hyperbilirubinemia monitoring3
1 Myers JG, Browne J. Point of care hematocrit and hemoglobin in cardiac surgery: a review. Perfusion. 2007 May;22(3):179-83.
2 Ancy J. Neonatal Critical Care Testing. RT for Decision Makers in Respiratory Care. 4 March, 2011.
3 Subcommittee on Hyperbilirubinemia, American Academy of Pediatrics, Clinical Practice Guidline: Management of hyperbilirubinemia in the newborn infant 35 or more weeks of gestation. Pediatrics. 2004 Jul;114(1):297-316.
translation.coox.button01: Absorbance spectra for CO-Ox analytes on GEM Premier 5000 system.
translation.coox.button02: iQM2 automatically corrects for low-to-moderate interference concentrations, such as lipemia and turbidity.
translation.coox.button03: High-resolution spectrometer quantitatively measures tHb and Hb derivative concentrations for unparalleled analytical performance.
translation.coox.button04: Sample is chemically lysed for a more complete and accurate CO-Ox reading.

coox.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“[CO-Oximetry is] the only accurate, consistent and reliable method to determine hemodilution and establish transfusion thresholds based on nadir Hcts during cardiopulmonary bypass, and immediately post-cardiac surgery.”
Gerard Myers, CCP, RRT
Manager, Cardiovascular Perfusion
QEII Health Sciences Center
Nova Scotia, Canada
Point of Care Hematocrit and Hemoglobin in Cardiac Surgery: A Review. Perfusion. 2007;Vol. 22.

translation.coox.popup02: CO-Oximetry optical assembly includes Spectrophotometer and LED contained within the analyzer.
translation.coox.popup03: Broad absorbance spectra ensures accurate results. Multi-wavelength spectrophotometry measurement is not affected by moderate turbidity or hemolysis
translation.coox.popup03.img: GEM Premier 5000 CO-Oximetry and Total Bilirubin Absorbance Spectra
translation.test.text:
Test Menu
GEM PAKs available in multiple menu and test-volume configurations to allow ultimate flexibility for any POCT location:
More than 30 PAK test menu/volume configuration options
31 day use-life* and no refrigeration required
Standardization maximizes efficiency
*21-day onboard use-life for 600-test PAK.
translation.test.text.table:
Flexible Customization
Test volumes: 75, 150, 300, 450, 600
Menu
Blood Gas, Hct, tHb, O2Hb, HHb, COHb, MetHb, sO2, tBili**
Blood Gas, Electrolytes, Hct, tHb, O2Hb, HHb, COHb, MetHb, sO2, tBili**
Blood Gas, Electrolytes, Glu, Lac, Hct, tHb, O2Hb, HHb, COHb, MetHb, sO2, tBili**
**PAKs available with or without tBili.

test.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“The integrated CO-Oximetry module enables full oxygenation status from a single sample. This is key [for labs seeking] to reduce capital expenditures, maintenance and costs.”
Edward Schrarger, RRT
Respiratory Therapy
Jamaica Hospital Medical Center
New York, USA
Clinical Performance Evaluation of the GEM Premier 4000 Analyzer. Clinical Study performed at Jamaica Hospital Medical Center, Jamaica, NY, USA. Data on file, IL.

translation.gemweb5:
GEMweb Plus 500
Custom Connectivity
Customizable connectivity and automated functionality for complete management of analyzers, operators and data oversight.

gemweb5.popup01.div:
Testimonial
“GEMweb Plus saves me at least an hour each day that I would otherwise have to spend administering analyzers all over the hospital.”
Robert Salvi, RPFT
Manager of Medical Services
Stamford Hospital
Connecticut, USA
IL Customer Case Study. Data on file, IL.

translation.gemweb5.popup02.title: Intuitive, simple dashboard, accessible from any analyzer, PC or tablet
translation.gemweb5.popup02: Access all data from a single dashboard, enhancing patient safety, quality management and compliance
translation.gemweb5.popup03: Provides customizable connectivity and automated functionality for complete management of analyzers, operators and data oversight.
translation.gemweb5.popup04: Seamless data integration for centralized management and simplified point-of-care
translation.simplify.text:
Simplify POCT
Simple web access from any browser
Optimized interface for access from
analyzer and tablet screens
Easy at-a-glance dashboard
Real-time remote management: full
access to analyzer configuration with
no testing interruption
Total automated management of
operators with multi-level authorization
and traceability of users, actions and
competence
translation.simplify.popup: Combines management of information, analyzers and operators into one easy-to-use package
translation.simplify.popup.02: Remote access of GEM systems from GEM systems
translation.poct.text:
Centralize POCT
Single unified database for patient
sample and historical result access
Connects to iQM/iQM2 data on GEM
Premier 3500/4000/5000 systems
Customizable connectivity with
multiple connections, including patient
monitors, EHR and ADT
Open connectivity, including analyzers
from non-IL manufacturers
† Contact your local Werfen representative for information on non-IL device connection details and availability.
translation.poct.popup: Designed to centralize operator supervision, quality management and full traceability, all from a single interface, whether accessed in the central lab, at the point-of-care or remotely from an analyzer, PC or tablet
translation.poct.popup.03: Remote management of analyzer in the network
translation.poct.popup.06: Multi-level operator access and automatic certification
